item.description:
Django Boston
Tue Jan 25 2011

6:30pm
Arrive early to chat about Django.

7:00pm Talks
Fresh on the heels of the New York and San Francisco Django User Groups, both which recently had record breaking attendance at their meetups on the subject of Django deployment, and Jacob Kaplan Moss' talk last month on DevOps, Nate Aune and Shimon Rura (from NodeRabbit/DjangoZoom) will lead a discussion about successful strategies for deploying Django apps.


Suggested topics include:

  • The ideal Django project directory layout
  • mod_wsgi vs gunicorn vs uWSGI
  • load balancing with Nginx, HAProxy
  • configuration management tools such as Chef and Puppet
  • Fabric for running commands on a remote server
  • serving static media files
  • pros/cons of using cloud hosting providers (Amazon EC2, Rackspace Cloud, etc.)
  • databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, CouchDB, MongoDB, etc)
  • monitoring with Munin, Nagios, Ganglia
  • other topics of interest


Please bring your examples and questions!

Thanks to Bocoup Loft for hosting!
item.name: Django deployment bonanza - Django Boston Meetup - Jan 2011
